Class Argument

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData.RationaleElement
      edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData.Argument
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Argument
extends RationaleElement
implements java.io.Serializable

Defines the structure for the arguments stored in the rationale

Author:
burgeje

public void setRequirement(Requirement newr)
Associate a requirement to our argument. We store the requirement, set our category to the correct value, and set the other possible argument types to null.

Parameters:
newr - - the requirement

theID - - the argument ID

delete

public boolean delete()
Delete our argument. This requires checking for any dependencies. If the argument is about a claim or an assumption we need to see who else refers to that claim or assumption. If no one else, we delete them too so we don't get orphaned rationale elements in the database that no one is using.

Overrides:
delete in class RationaleElement
Returns:
true

inDatabase

private boolean inDatabase(int parentID,
                           RationaleElementType ptype)
Check if our element is already in the database. The check is different if you are reading it in from XML because you can do a query on the name. Otherwise you can't because you run the risk of the user having changed the name.

Parameters:
parentID - the parent ID
ptype - the parent type
Returns:
true if in the database already
